title: BSF Intensifies Vigil Along Bangladesh Border But Tripura Poses Challenges
content: The Border Security Force has intensified their vigil along Tripura's 856-km-long international border with Bangladesh, but stopping cross-border infiltration remains a herculean task.

title: Trump To Sign Order Targeting Cities Defying Immigration Laws
content: US President Donald Trump plans to sign an executive order on Monday directing the attorney general and the secretary of Homeland Security to identify within a month the cities and states that are not complying with federal immigration laws.

title: For Indus Waters, Two Storage Facilities Being Built, Former Official Tells NDTV
content: India is building two water storage facilities which would help store the whole of Indus water now that the Water sharing treaty with Pakistan has been put on hold indefinitely, AK Bajaj, Former Commissioner (Indus) told NDTV.

title: Hearts Bleed For Rogue Nation: Anurag Thakur On Congress Leader's Pak Comment
content: The BJP's Anurag Thakur has slammed Congress leader Saifuddin Soz's remarks on Pakistan and India's move to put the Indus Waters Treaty on hold, accusing him of "shamelessly defending Pakistan".

title: Video: Siddaramaiah's Slap Gesture At Cop After He Loses Cool On Stage
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah snapped at a police officer during a Congress rally today. The Chief Minister lost his cool and nearly slapped the police officer after he was shown black flags at the rally in Belagavi.

title: Mega Power Outage Hits Spain, France, Portugal, Millions Without Electricity
content: Spanish power grid operator Red Electrica said it was working with energy companies to restore power after large parts of Spain and Portugal were hit by a power outage on Monday.

title: Putin Announces Ukraine Ceasefire May 8-10
content: The ceasefire is taking place on Russia's Victory Day on May 9th, which marks the end of the Second World War.

title: Woman Raped By 3 Men Near Railway Station In Bihar's Patna: Cops
content: In a shocking incident, a woman was gang-raped by three men near Sasamusa railway station under the Kuchaykot police station area of Gopalganj district on Monday.

title: Indian Pilgrims Can Visit Holy Sites In Tibet This Summer: China
content: China's foreign ministry announced on Monday that Indian pilgrims would be able to travel to holy sites in Tibet for the first time in five years this summer, in the latest sign of warming relations between the two regional superpower.

title: Maharashtra Woman Dies As Dress Catches Fire During 'Puja' At Home: Cops
content: A 48-year-old woman died after suffering severe burn injuries while performing a religious ritual at her home in Maharashtra's Thane district, police said.

title: Live Updates: Millions Across Spain, Portugal, France Face Sudden Power Outage
content: Spain Power Outage: Millions are facing a power outage in Spain, Portugal and parts of southern France. The cause for the outage was not immediately identified.

title: Canadian Election 2025 LIVE: Who Will Be New PM- Liberal Mark Carney Or Conservative Pierre Poilievre
content: Canadian Election 2025 LIVE: Canadians are set to vote today (Monday) to decide whether to extend the Prime Minister Mark Carney-led Liberal Party's decade in power or hand over the country's control to Pierre Poilievre's Conservatives.

title: Millions left in dark; trains stuck in tunnels: Blackout hits Spain, Portugal, France & Belgium
content: A massive blackout plunged millions across Spain, Portugal, and parts of southern France into darkness on Monday. Train services were severely disrupted in Spain, while Portugal's REN operator confirmed the widespread impact. The outage, which began around 12:30 pm local time, affected critical infrastructure, including Spain's Parliament and metro stations.

title: 'Who killed your mother?': Owaisi slams Bhutto's 'blood will flow' remark
content: Asaduddin Owaisi criticized Bilawal Bhutto Zardari's threat regarding the Indus Waters Treaty, reminding him of his mother's assassination by terrorism. Owaisi questioned Zardari's understanding of terrorism's impact, highlighting the suffering it inflicts on innocent people. Zardari's remarks followed India's suspension of the treaty after a deadly terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Watch: Siddaramaiah loses cool, makes slapping gesture at cop on stage
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah faced controversy after gesturing at a police officer during a rally disruption by BJP workers in Belagavi. He also drew criticism from the BJP for suggesting India avoid war with Pakistan, prioritizing security. Siddaramaiah accused the BJP and media of misquoting him, clarifying he views war as a last resort.

title: Watch: Chaos erupts after major power outage hits Europe
content: A massive power outage plunged millions across Spain, Portugal, and parts of southern France into chaos on Monday. The blackout disrupted transport and communication systems, leaving people stranded in subway stations and causing widespread flight cancellations. Authorities are investigating the cause of the outage, which affected critical infrastructure and prompted selective power cuts to stabilize the network.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is not 'happy', says 'We should have been ... '
content: Elon Musk expressed his disappointment that humans haven't reached Mars yet, despite SpaceX's efforts. He referenced the rapid progress from the first flight to the moon landing, highlighting the current delay in space exploration.

title: Former Pakistan cricketer slams Shahid Afridi over 'extremist' views
content: Danish Kaneria has strongly criticised Shahid Afridi for his extremist views and controversial statements, particularly blaming India for the Pahalgam terrorist attack. Kaneria accused Afridi of attempting to convert him to Islam and refusing to share meals. Afridi, in turn, accused India of orchestrating terror attacks and blamed Indian media for sensationalising the Pahalgam tragedy.

title: Man beaten, nearly thrown off moving train for watching Pahalgam terror reel
content: A 23-year-old man was allegedly abused and assaulted on a Bhopal-Indore passenger train for watching a reel about the Pahalgam terror attack. The two unidentified accused argued with the victim, made objectionable comments about India and the Constitution, and even threatened to throw him off the moving train. GRP has registered a case and is investigating using CCTV footage to identify the perpetrators.

title: What woke up Godfather of AI in the middle of night, 'I dreamt about…'
content: Geoffrey Hinton, the "Godfather of AI," surprisingly won the Nobel Prize in physics for his neural network innovations that underpin today's LLMs. Despite his contributions, Hinton expresses growing concern about AI's rapid advancement, likening it to raising a potentially dangerous tiger cub.

title: Reduced to 'bag of bones': Husband, in-laws sentenced for starving woman to death
content: A Kerala court convicted a man and his mother for the dowry death of his wife, Thushara, in 2019. The 28-year-old victim was starved and weighed only 20-21 kilograms at the time of her death. Chandulal and Geetha were found guilty of torture and starvation, with the husband demanding additional dowry shortly after their marriage in 2013.

title: 'Hardik & his little Paltan': MI captain's special moment with a fan - Watch
content: Mumbai Indians secured a dominant 54-run victory against Lucknow Super Giants, marking their fifth consecutive win and propelling them to third place in the IPL 2025 standings. Captain Hardik Pandya's heartfelt gesture of gifting his cap to a young fan during the post-match celebrations at Wankhede went viral, highlighting the strong connection between the team and its supporters.

title: DeepSeek that created havoc in the US tech industry is hiring for an ‘urgent’ job
content: DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup, is shifting its focus from research to commercialization, seeking product management and design talent to develop intelligent products based on its language models. The company, known for its cost-effective R1 model, is also hiring C-suite executives and preparing to launch its R2 model. DeepSeek's open-source approach contrasts with its American counterparts.

title: 5 Dead After Speeding Car Rams Logistic Vehicle In Andhra Pradesh: Cops
content: Five people were killed and two injured when their speeding car rammed into a logistics vehicle near Thotapalli village in this district on Monday afternoon, police said.

title: How This 77-Year-Old Woman Has A Body As Fit As That Of A 25-Year-Old
content: A 77-year-old woman hassecured the first position in the 75-79 age group at the 2025 Boston Marathon. Jeannie Rice completed the marathon, her 134th, in 4 hours, 27 minutes, and 17 seconds.

title: Kevin Hart Cancels India Tour In Solidarity With Pahalgam Attack Victims
content: Following the tragic terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, which claimed the lives of 26 people, comedian and actor Kevin Hart has cancelled his Delhi leg of his 'Acting My Age' tour, initially scheduled for April 30.

title: Cardinals' Conclave To Elect New Pope To Begin May 7: Vatican
content: Roman Catholic cardinals will meet in a secret conclave to elect the new leader of the global Church starting from May 7, a senior Vatican source said on Monday.

title: Congress's Firefight Amid Row Over Party Leaders' Pahalgam Attack Remarks
content: Determined to put an end to controversies arising from its leaders' off-the-cuff remarks on the Pahalgam terror attack, the Congress leadership has asked party members to avoid making unnecessary remarks

title: Kim Kadashian To Testify In Paris Jewel Theft Trial Of 'Grandpa Robbers'
content: Kim Kardashian is due to testify in the Paris trial that begins Monday of the "grandpa robbers" accused of stealing $10 million worth of jewellery from the billionaire high priestess of social media.

title: After Steps Against Pak, Northeast Seeks Similar Move Against Bangladesh
content: Days after India imposed a series of severe measures against Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack, key political figures and parties in Northeast India have called for similar action against Bangladesh.

title: 'With what face can I ask for statehood for J&K?' CM Omar in assembly
content: Following the tragic terror attack in Pahalgam that resulted in 26 fatalities, Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah addressed the state assembly, expressing his grief and stating he would not demand statehood at this time. He emphasized that militancy can only be eradicated with the support of the people, not just through force.

title: 26/11 terror attack plotter Tahawwur Rana's custody extended by 12 days
content: An NIA court has extended the detention of Tahawwur Rana, accused in the 26/11 Mumbai terror attack, by 12 days after his extradition to India. Rana, reportedly uncooperative during questioning by Mumbai Police, appeared in court under tight security. The NIA seeks to further investigate the conspiracy, while Rana's legal team is provided by the Delhi Legal Services Authority.

title: Pope Francis' successor to be chosen in conclave starting May 7
content: Following the death of Pope Francis on April 21, 2025, at the age of 88, cardinals will convene in Rome to elect his successor. The conclave is set to begin on May 7, preceded by a solemn mass at St Peter's Basilica on May 3.

title: 'When I first met Virat Kohli ... ': Preity Zinta opens up
content: Following RCB's victory, Virat Kohli and Preity Zinta shared a heartwarming exchange, discussing their children and reminiscing about Kohli's early days. Kohli, currently the leading run-scorer in IPL 2025, also highlighted the importance of partnerships after RCB's win over Delhi Capitals, praising Krunal Pandya's contribution to the successful chase. As of now, Kohli is the leading run-scorer in IPL 2025, amassing 443 runs in 10 matches at an impressive average of 63.29, including six half-centuries.

title: Watch: DEA agents smash windows, arrest over 100 in Colorado Springs nightclub raid
content: In Colorado Springs, a DEA raid on an illegal after-hours nightclub resulted in over 100 suspected undocumented immigrants' arrests. The operation, involving 300 officers, followed investigations into drug trafficking and violent crime. Authorities seized cocaine and firearms. Donald Trump shared the raid footage, highlighting his administration's strict immigration enforcement.

title: Chewing or swallowing chia seeds: Best way to consume for hair growth
content: Chia seeds, rich in omega-3s, protein, and minerals, are beneficial for hair health. To maximize nutrient absorption for hair growth, soaking chia seeds is the most effective method. Chewing is a decent alternative, but swallowing them whole is less beneficial. Consistency in consumption, along with a balanced diet and proper hair care, is crucial for optimal results.

title: India, France sign Rs 63,000 crore mega deal to buy 26 Rafale Marine aircraft
content: India and France have finalized a significant deal. The agreement involves the purchase of 26 Rafale Marine aircraft for the Indian Navy. The deal is worth Rs 63,000 crore. These jets will operate from INS Vikrant. The contract includes weapons, training, and support. Deliveries are expected between 37 to 65 months. This acquisition enhances India's maritime capabilities.

title: Trae Young drops heartfelt 5-word reaction to Damian Lillard's latest injury
content: Damian Lillard's left foot injury during Game 4 against the Pacers has cast a pall over the Milwaukee Bucks' playoff aspirations. After recently returning from a calf injury, Lillard's Achilles tendon issue, potentially a tear, further complicates the Bucks' already precarious 3-1 series deficit. With a crucial Game 5 looming, the team's championship hopes hang in the balance.

title: Indian-origin man smashes windows of Pak High Commission in UK, held
content: Tensions between India and Pakistan have spilled over into London, marked by escalating protests from both diasporas. An Indian-origin man, Ankit Love, was arrested for allegedly vandalizing the Pakistani High Commission. These incidents follow a recent terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir, further straining the already fraught relationship between the two nations, leading to heightened security concerns in London.

title: Amir's fiery gesture to Viv Richards after Babar Azam's dismissal
content: In a high-octane Pakistan Super League clash, Mohammad Amir and Babar Azam reignited their rivalry. Amir struck Babar with a bouncer, later dismissing him with a sharp inswinger. Amir's emphatic celebration towards Viv Richards followed, though Richards urged him to remain composed. Amir finished with figures of 1/18, making a significant impact.

title: Preity Zinta reveals Shreyas was PBKS' only choice for captaincy at auction
content: Punjab Kings co-owner Preity Zinta lauded skipper Shreyas Iyer as a "down-to-earth guy and an amazing captain" during a recent social media Q&A. She revealed Iyer was PBKS's sole captaincy choice at the 2024 IPL auction, shaping their entire strategy. Under Iyer's leadership, Punjab Kings are currently fifth in the IPL 2025 standings, firmly in playoff contention.

title: Delhi to Jaipur in 2.5 hours via new Delhi-Mumbai Expressway link! Details here
content: From June, travel between Delhi and Jaipur will be significantly faster, thanks to a new connection from the Delhi-Mumbai expressway to the Jaipur Ring Road.  NHAI is ensuring thorough inspections and preventive maintenance to avoid post-inauguration issues as well.

title: Bumrah breaks Malinga's MI record, but says: 'He's still better'
content: Jasprit Bumrah surpassed Lasith Malinga as Mumbai Indians' all-time leading wicket-taker with a fiery 4/22 against Lucknow Super Giants. Following MI's dominant 54-run victory, a heartwarming exchange between Bumrah and Malinga went viral, with Malinga acknowledging Bumrah as "the best." Mumbai Indians secured their fifth consecutive win, propelling them to third place in the standings.

title: Why did stock market rise today? BSE Sensex closes over 1,000 points up
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, rallied strongly in trade on Monday. While BSE Sensex went above 80,300, Nifty50 crossed 24,350 intraday.

title: 'Enemy of people': Trump slams 'sick media' over low approval rating reports
content: Donald Trump has launched a fierce attack on major media outlets, branding them as "the enemy of the people" following reports of historically low 100-day presidential approval ratings. He specifically targeted The New York Times, ABC News, The Washington Post, and Fox News, accusing them of disseminating "fake polls.

title: Where is Asim Munir? Pakistan PMO shares photo with Shehbaz Sharif amid 'missing' buzz
content: Amidst escalating tensions with India following the Pahalgam attack, the Pakistan Prime Minister's Office released a photo of Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif alongside Army chief General Asim Munir to dispel rumors of his disappearance. The image, taken at the Pakistan Military Academy, surfaces after Munir's controversial speech emphasizing the "two-nation theory," further fueling the ongoing conflict.

title: RBI's new ATM rules effective from May 1: All you need to know
content: Starting May 1, 2025, the RBI's revised ATM transaction framework will introduce changes to free limits and charges. Customers get three free ATM transactions in metro areas and five elsewhere. Beyond these, a Rs 23 fee applies, prompting banks like HDFC and PNB to notify customers of the updated charges, aiming to streamline usage and promote digital banking.

title: 'Not our domain, you do something': SC to Centre on plea to ban obscenity on OTT
content: The Supreme Court has addressed a plea concerning the regulation of sexually explicit content on OTT platforms and social media, issuing a notice to the Centre. The court emphasized that implementing controls on indecent content primarily falls under the Executive and Legislature's responsibility. The government informed the court about existing regulations and contemplated additional restrictions to address the issue.

title: India's Got Latent row: Supreme Court directs return of Ranveer Allahbadia's passport
content: The Supreme Court has permitted podcaster Ranveer Allahbadia, also known as BeerBiceps, to reclaim his passport for international work travel. This decision follows the completion of investigations by Assam and Maharashtra into the "India's Got Latent" case involving him. The court is also considering consolidating the FIRs against Allahbadia into a single case.

title: Rs 1,500, a photo & a lie for Aadhaar: In UP, touts clone ‘deputy CM’
content: A fraudulent Aadhaar demographic update in Brajesh Pathak's name was rejected by UIDAI's system due to invalid documents and discrepancies. This follows an exposé on intermediaries exploiting vulnerable individuals with counterfeit documents. Consequently, an eviction notice has been issued to a café operating with a suspected Aadhaar Seva Kendra staff member, following reports of tout activity.

title: Aunt’s call from Singapore saves girl from dad’s abuse
content: A phone call from Singapore unveiled a Chennai girl's abuse, leading to her father's arrest based on medical evidence and initial testimony. Despite the child later retracting her statements and expressing a desire for family reunification, the trial court, considering the prior evidence, sentenced the father to 20 years imprisonment and imposed a fine.

title: RR vs GT: Playing XI Prediction, pitch report, weather update
content: Gujarat Titans will aim to solidify their playoff position against Rajasthan Royals. Shubman Gill's team, powered by standout performances from Sai Sudharsan and Prasidh Krishna, faces a struggling Royals side that has lost five consecutive matches. The Jaipur pitch is expected to favour fast bowlers, with a par score around 185.

title: 'Provocative, communal content': Govt bans 16 Pakistan YouTube channels
content: The Indian government has banned 16 Pakistani YouTube channels for allegedly spreading misinformation and communally sensitive content. This action follows diplomatic measures against Pakistan, including visa suspensions and the halting of the Indus Waters Treaty, in response to the Pahalgam terror attack. Pakistan has denied involvement in the attack, calling for an independent investigation.

title: 'Do terrorists have time for this?': Cong MLA's question on Pahalgam attack sparks row
content: Congress MLA Vijay Wadettiwar questioned the Pahalgam terror attack, doubting if terrorists verified victims' religions before killing them, urging the central government to take responsibility. This sparked controversy, with the BJP criticizing Congress for allegedly excusing Pakistan and undermining national unity. The NIA has intensified its investigation into the deadly attack, which occurred in the Baisaran meadow near Pahalgam.

title: Krunal Pandya credits former RCB skipper for his match-winning knock
content: Krunal Pandya gave credit to Virat Kohli for his match-winning innings against Delhi Capitals. He scored 73 runs off 47 balls. They had a 119-run partnership. Pandya mentioned Kohli's energy was infectious. He also said Kohli kept backing him. Pandya added that he focused on not giving up. RCB is currently at the top of the points table.

title: J&K attack: Govt writes to BBC over its report terming 'terrorists' as 'militants'
content: The government has formally protested BBC's use of "militants" instead of "terrorists" in its coverage of the Pahalgam attack, which resulted in 26 deaths. Simultaneously, India banned 16 Pakistani YouTube channels, including prominent networks like Dawn News and Geo News, for allegedly spreading misinformation and provocative content against India, its army, and security agencies following the tragic incident.

title: Indus Waters Treaty: Modi govt to expedite 5 hydro power projects
content: India is accelerating five hydroelectric projects in Jammu & Kashmir after suspending the Indus Waters Treaty, aiming to boost power generation in the region by 4000MW. These projects, including Bursar, Dulhasti II, Swalkote, Uri Stage II, and Kirthai II, could be completed in 3-5 years.

title: What carved this long, winding line on Mars? NASA has the answer
content: NASA's Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter captured a stunning image of the Curiosity rover in motion, revealing its winding trail across the Martian surface. The rover, heading towards a region with potential signs of ancient groundwater activity, left tracks spanning over 1,050 feet. This marks the first mid-drive photo of Curiosity, showcasing its ongoing exploration and impact on the Red Planet.

title: Virat Kohli: 'I try and make sure my singles and doubles don't stop...'
content: Virat Kohli highlighted his focus on analysing conditions and rotating the strike after Royal Challengers Bengaluru's six-wicket victory over Delhi Capitals. Kohli (51) and Krunal Pandya (73 not out) forged a crucial 119-run partnership. Axar Patel, Delhi Capitals' skipper, felt his team fell 10-15 runs short.

title: Son of Falcons coordinator behind Sanders prank
content: The son of Falcons defensive coordinator Jeff Ulbrich admitted to being the one behind a prank call to Shedeur Sanders during Day 2 of the NFL draft.

title: Two-time Cup winner Sullivan out as Pens coach
content: Mike Sullivan, who led the Pittsburgh Penguins to back-to-back Stanley Cups in 2016 and 2017, is out as the team's head coach, it was announced on Monday.

title: Commanders, D.C. reach deal for stadium at RFK
content: The Commanders agreed to a deal with the District of Columbia to build a new stadium at the RFK site.

title: Ant zooms past 'gassed' Lakers to take 3-1 lead
content: Anthony Edwards was able to "keep my foot on the pedal" and take advantage of a gassed Lakers team to the tune of 16 points in the fourth quarter.

title: Fan ejected after taunting Red Sox OF Duran
content: A fan in Cleveland was ejected Sunday after saying "something inappropriate" to Boston's Jarren Duran, who revealed in a documentary earlier this month that he attempted suicide three years ago.

title: Officials admit error with Knicks-Pistons ending
content: Crew chief David Guthrie said referees missed Knicks guard Josh Hart's foul of Detroit's Tim Hardaway Jr. on the final shot of the Pistons' loss to the Knicks in Game 4 on Sunday.

title: Saigo wins LPGA major Chevron in 5-way playoff
content: Mao Saigo of Japan won the Chevron Championship on Sunday for her first major title, making a 3-foot birdie putt on the first hole of a five-way playoff.

title: Steph and Draymond's 'last ride' comes down to Playoff Jimmy
content: Ten years after their first title, Curry and Green know Butler is the key to their pursuit of a fifth ring.

title: Browns gamble on Shedeur Sanders after drafting Dillon Gabriel: What's the plan?
content: Answering the biggest questions surrounding Cleveland's selection of Sanders in the fifth round, including reaction from around the league.

title: Garcia, Lopez, Canelo and Inoue in the same weekend? Get ready!
content: An FAQ as a guide to the Times Square card, Canelo Alvarez's in Saudi Arabia and Naoya Inoue's return to the U.S. on the same weekend.

title: Stanley Cup takeaways as Round 1 heats up: Who is poised to move on -- and why
content: Winnipeg is reeling, the Panthers are stirring things up and Toronto is looking for a finishing touch -- again.

title: How Arne Slot, Liverpool won the Premier League in 2024-25
content: It seemed impossible to follow club legend Jurgen Klopp and win the league in his first year, but Arne Slot has done just that at Liverpool.

title: UFC 318 reactions: What would a BMF title win mean for Dustin Poirier?
content: Dustin Poirier will take on ex-featherweight champion Max Holloway one last time for the BMF title at UFC 318.

title: Slot sings to Klopp after Liverpool clinch PL title
content: Arne Slot sang Jürgen Klopp's name on the pitch at Anfield as Liverpool celebrated their Premier League title win.

title: MLS investigating discrimination in Vancouver win
content: MLS announced it is aware of a reported violation of the league's Non-Discrimination Policy that occurred in Sunday's match between Minnesota United FC and the Vancouver Whitecaps, and will "immediately begin a thorough review of the matter."

title: Arsenal comeback over Lyon 'unexplainable' - boss
content: Arsenal reached their first Women's Champions League final in 18 years on Sunday, taking down French powerhouse Lyon with a remarkable 4-1 away win.

title: Source: Ancelotti, Pérez to hold Madrid exit talks
content: Carlo Ancelotti will meet with Real Madrid president Florentino Pérez in the coming days to discuss the coach's departure from the club, a source told ESPN.

title: Wrexham plan 'no superstars' policy - Parkinson
content: Wrexham will operate a "no superstars and no egos" policy when they target new signings for their Premier League push next season.

title: Sources: Miami waives Gressel before Loons move
content: Inter Miami CF is waiving Julian Gressel, clearing the way for the midfielder to head to Minnesota United FC, sources tell ESPN.

title: McTominay double puts Napoli 3 clear in Serie A
content: Two first-half goals from Scott McTominay helped Napoli to a 2-0 home win against Torino in Serie A on Sunday as the hosts reclaimed the sole lead in the standings with four games left to play.

title: Liverpool clinch Prem title, match Man Utd record
content: Liverpool have been crowned Premier League champions after a 5-1 win over Tottenham on Sunday, securing their 20th league title.

title: Wrexham's latest promotion is a miracle. The next will be even harder
content: Wrexham's third straight promotion has them on the Premier League's doorstep. Getting there will be much harder.

title: Eubank Jr. should focus on Canelo, rather than Benn rematch
content: Forget a rematch with Conor Benn, the focus for Chris Eubank Jr should now fully be on Canelo Alvarez

title: Should you draft Caitlin Clark or A'ja Wilson at No. 1?
content: A'ja Wilson opened as the top ranked player in fantasy women's basketball entering the 2025 season, but does someone else have a case to supplant Wilson in 2025?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man Utd to trigger Cunha's $84M release clause
content: Is Matheus Cunha the man to solve Manchester United's attacking woes? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Watch: Scottish leader Anas Sarwar asks Pakistanis to 'take power'

title: India, France Sign Rs 63,000 Crore Deal For 26 Rafale-M Jets For Navy
content: the Rafale-M is the maritime version of Dassault Aviation's fighter jet (File) 26 fighter jets have been bought from the u.s. to complete a record government-to-government deal . the deal includes fleet maintenance, logistical support, and personnel training . it is a big moment for indigenous manufacturing of components .

title: Playoffs daily: Round 4 of the Battle of Florida, pivotal Game 5 for Avs-Stars
content: home teams are on a tear in the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs, going 21-10 thus far . the early matchup is Game 4 of the Battle of Florida . Tampa Bay Lightning forward Brandon Hagel was given a major penalty for his hit on Florida Panthers captain Aleksander Barkov in Game 2 .

title: Western Conference playoffs: LeBron, Luka cannot save Lakers from 3-1 hole
content: the 2024-25 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . the no. 4 seed Denver Nuggets evened the series with the No. 5 seed LA Clippers after an exciting Game 4 .

title: 6-team mock draft: How early did Paige Bueckers go?
content: the 2025 WNBA season is set to tip off on may 16, the ESPN experts came together for a fantasy women's basketball mock draft . we used the default settings -- a six-team league with nine players per team and the following scoring system . the participants of this mock draft were Charlie Creme, Eric Moody, Jason Shebilske, andre Snellings .

title: Pistons' adjustments, Warriors' needs: What we learned in the first week of the playoffs
content: the Eastern Conference has been a battleground, as the no. 4 seed Denver Nuggets and the fifth-seeded LA Clippers are neck and neck after opening up their series with an overtime thriller followed by a game-winning buzzer-beating dunk from Denver's Aaron Gordon . the future of the 7-seed Golden State Warriors remains a mystery .

title: Transfer portal's lure involves more than just a big payday for players
content: Clayton Powell-Lee has spent the past month searching for an answer . he can build on his 53 tackles last season, after which he landed a six-figure name, image and likeness contract with the school . the market for defensive backs is booming, his agents say .

title: Eastern Conference playoffs: Takeaways from every game, including Knicks' narrow win
content: a controversial no-call on Tim Hardaway Jr.'s 3-point attempt results in the Knicks narrowly winning Game 4 over the Pistons . the Cleveland Cavaliers took a commanding 3-0 lead over the Miami Heat on Saturday without Darius Garland, handing the Heat their worst-ever playoff loss .

title: Sources: Possible Achilles injury for Bucks' Lillard
content: Damian Lillard suffered an apparent leg injury in the first quarter . he will undergo an MRI on Monday to determine the severity of the left lower leg injury . the injury forced him to exit the game 4 loss to the Indiana Pacers . "just being honest, it's not very promising," coach says postgame .

title: 32 teams, 32 questions, 32 answers: Taking stock of what's ahead this offseason
content: the 2025 NFL draft wrapped up in green Bay, Wisconsin . there are 257 new faces joining the league, but will they help solve teams' woes? what questions linger after the three-day player selection extravaganza .

title: Ex-Suzuki Motor chief Osamu Suzuki, singer Pankaj Udhas, Sushil Modi among Padma awardees
content: 71 awardees were given the awards at Rashtrapati Bhavan's majestic Durbar Hall on April 28; the remaining will be conferred with the decorations at a separate function to be held soon

title: Srikakulam artist draws miniature painting of Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy on a peacock feather
content: Artist Rahul Patnaik showcased a miniature Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy painting on a peacock feather ahead of Simhachalam Chandanotsavam

title: 'Krishna Janmabhoomi' case: Allahabad HC appears to be correct in impleading Centre, ASI in dispute, says Supreme Court
content: The Allahabad High Court on March 5, 2025, allowed amendments to two lawsuits and permitted petitioners to make Centre's MHA and the Archaeological Survey of India as respondents

title: Construction of new rocket launchpad and NGLV in Sriharikota offer a huge opportunity for developing aerospace manufacturing ecosystem in Andhra Pradesh, says former ISRO chairman Somanath
content: ‘Commercial space launches are an opportunity which the country could not afford to miss but it has to overcome a plethora of challenges that stymied the capabilities of the industries looking to contribute to space exploration’

title: Union Minister urged to set up skill development centres in Srikakulam district
content: BJP leader submits representation to Union Minister Pemmasani regarding mass migration and low per capita income that have been plaguing the district and seeks his support for the initiation of development activities in the district

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Supreme Court declines ED’s plea to bar Senthilbalaji from holding any office till completion of trial
content: Bench of Justices A.S. Oka and A.G. Masih found ‘no basis in the apprehension’ of the ED and the complainant, K. Vidhya Kumar, that the T.N Minister would again return to a position of power in the State ‘in a month’

title: Centre’s attempts to centralise powers in the cooperative sector not in the best interests of the country: K.N. Balagopal
content: Unilateral decisions taken by the Centre in the cooperative sector are designed to assume control over the funds in the sector, says Kerala Finance Minister

title: Bengaluru Namma Metro commuter fined ₹500 for eating on train
content: The passenger was penalised after being caught eating while onboard a Namma Metro train on April 26, 2025. A concerned co-passenger had recorded the violation and shared it on social media.

title: Senior Indian diplomat holds talks with Taliban's acting foreign minister in Kabul
content: India has not yet recognised the Taliban regime in Afghanistan and has been pitching for the formation of a truly inclusive government in Kabul besides insisting that Afghan soil must not be used for any terrorist activities

title: Madras High Court reverses discharge of T.N. Minister I. Periyasamy from disproportionate assets case
content: Justice P. Velmurugan directs the Minister, his wife, and two sons to face a full-fledged trial before a special court in Dindigul

title: British man traces ancestor’s grave to Secunderabad after 119 years
content: With the support of The Hindu, 67-year-old Robin Dickson, a fourth-generation British officer, fulfils his longtime dream to locate the grave of his great-grandfather, Lt. Wilson, who died in Secunderabad in 1906

title: Andhra Pradesh government forms expert panel to oversee new excise management system
content: The system aims to ensure complete end-to-end supervision using an advanced technology-driven mechanism

title: 26/11 Mumbai attack: Delhi court extends Tahawwur Rana’s NIA custody for 12 more days
content: Special NIA judge Chander Jit Singh extended Rana's custody on NIA's request after his previous 18-day remand got over

title: Suspension of Indus Waters Treaty: Naresh Tikait speaking 'language of Pakistan,' BJP attacks farmer leader for disagreement
content: Naresh Tikait remarked that the Narendra Modi government should not have suspended the Indus Waters treaty with Pakistan as it would affect the common people, especially farmers, in the neighbouring country

title: Mandya achieves 102% target under MGNREGA, sets new benchmark in rural employment in Karnataka
content: Against the targeted 27 lakh man-days for the district, Mandya successfully generated 27,69,096 man-days of employment

title: Rajasthan teacher forces student to cut, clean chicken during exam; suspended
content: Other students also claimed that the teacher had dismissed the school cook from duty around a month ago

title: Supreme Court junks plea against Telangana rule mandating proficiency in Telugu for civil judge post
content: Supreme Court dismisses plea challenging Telugu language proficiency rule for Telangana civil judge post

title: Celebrating art deco buildings in Hyderabad, 100 years after birth of architectural style in Paris
content: The architectural idiom born on April 29, 1925, in France is hidden in plain sight in the city of Hyderabad and will present itself to those who pause to appreciate the arresting sights of the buildings

title: Andhra Government extends suspension of senior IPS officer P.V. Sunil Kumar on allegations of multiple foreign visits without permission
content: Recently, the government also decided to initiate disciplinary proceedings against Sunil Kumar, who is facing charges related to misbehaviour and misconduct

title: Kerala ASHA workers to launch Statewide protest march from Kasaragod on May 5
content: Kerala ASHA Health Workers Association says march aims to generate awareness about its demands across the State and will culminate in Thiruvananthapuram on June 17

title: Chandrababu Naidu holds teleconference with NDA leaders; says Amaravati symbol of pride, self-respect for people of Andhra Pradesh
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu also said no inconvenience should be caused to people attending the event, and that the leaders should take responsibility to ensure smooth proceedings

title: T.N. government introduces Bill making original documents necessary for immovable property registration
content: On April 7 this year, the Supreme Court, in its judgment, held that the rule-making power under Section 69 cannot be exercised to make a rule that was inconsistent with the provisions of the Registration Act, 1908

title: NEET-UG plan: Transport of question papers under police escort, monitoring of coaching centres
content: Ministry of Education meets with officials to ensure NEET-UG exam integrity, implementing strict security measures for fair conduct

title: T.N. government moves Bill to name CM Stalin as Chancellor of proposed Kalaignar University
content: The proposed Kalaignar University would be established by bifurcating Bharathidasan University and would provide world-class facilities aimed at uplifting marginalised communities in Ariyalur, Nagapattinam, Thanjavur, and Tiruvarur districts, the Bill stated

title: Kharge slams PM Modi for skipping all-party meet on Pahalgam attack; accuses BJP of trying to divide people
content: “Was Bihar far away? The Prime Minister should have come to the all-party meeting and explained the plan. What help does he need from us?”

title: India, France conclude inter-governmental agreement for 26 Rafale-M jets for Navy
content: The deal will also see the integration of the indigenous Beyond Visual Range air to air missile Astra on the Rafales

title: T.N. government to restore EL surrender system from October 1, announces 2% hike in DA for employees
content: Speaking in the Assembly, Chief Minister M.K. Stalin made nine key announcements for the welfare of government employees

title: India's Got Latent row: Supreme Court orders return of passport to Ranveer Allahbadia
content: Allahbadia, popularly known as BeerBiceps, was booked for his controversial comments made on comic Samay Raina's YouTube show "India's Got Latent".

title: Will strengthen people's fight against terrorism, says Omar Abdullah
content: Mr. Abdullah, however, cautioned that the government should avoid any step that will alienate the public.

title: Fresh wave of hoax bomb threats targets Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan’s office, residence and Kochi airport
content: Sender claims an anonymous saboteur planted a ‘sulfur and RDX-based IED’ at Cliff House, the official residence of Kerala Chief Minister

title: Supreme Court notice to Centre, others on plea to ban sexually explicit content on OTT, social media platforms
content: The Supreme Court was hearing a plea filed by five petitioners who have also sought guidelines constituting a National Content Control Authority to prohibit sexually explicit content on OTT and social media platforms

title: Conservancy workers’ unions demand revised summer work hours after man dies on duty in Madurai
content: Manivel reportedly fainted due to the heat while removing garbage from a locality in Ward 5 of Madurai Corporation, and in the process, hit his head on a stone

title: Surprise inspection finds none of the Class 10 students at Uttar Pradesh madrassa were able to write names in English
content: Surprise inspection reveals poor education quality at madrassa in Bahraich district, with class 10 students unable to write their names or the name of the madrassa in English

title: Pahalgam terror attack | Defence Minister Rajnath Singh to brief PM Modi on J&K situation
content: The briefing is taking place as India mulls its options to punish those behind the terror attack on April 22 that killed 26 civilians

title: Supreme Court refuses to entertain fresh plea challenging Waqf (Amendment) Act
content: While appointing three lawyers as the nodal counsel, the bench asked the advocates to decide among themselves who was going to argue

title: Watch: U.S. denied half a million student visas in two years
content: We use data to compare visa denials across countries and examine the increasing pressure on Indian students in the U.S.

title: Wife of BSF jawan detained by Pakistan heads to Ferozepur to seek updates on husband's return
content: The Indian and Pakistani border forces held a flag meeting to negotiate BSF jawan Sahu's release, officials said on Thursday night, but the family has not received any further updates

title: Liquor trade: ED conducts raids in Madhya Pradesh
content: The ED suspects that the accused liquor contractors used to prepare challans of small amounts and deposit them in the bank

title: ‘Hybrid ganja’ found in possession of film directors sourced from supplier in Kerala, say Excise officials
content: Prominent Malayalam movie directors Khalid Rahman and Ashraf Hamsa were arrested with 1.50 grams of suspected hybrid ganja when they allegedly were just about to use it during a pre-dawn raid on Sunday

title: Four killed as car rams into stationary truck in M.P.'s Dhar district
content: The car crashed into the truck from behind, killing four of its occupants on the spot, CSP Ravindra Vaskel sai

title: Pahalgam attack: J&K Assembly passes resolution denouncing Pahalgam attack; Omar says he failed as CM
content: “The peaceful demonstrations across towns and villages, and the spontaneous outpouring of moral and material support towards tourists, reaffirm people’s steadfast commitment to peace, communal harmony, and the rule of law,” the resolution stated.

title: Infrastructure gaps to delay liquor service at Infopark Kochi despite Kerala’s new permit rule
content: Kerala government has notified Foreign Liquor (5th Amendment) Rules, inserting a provision for issuance of Foreign Liquor Information Technology Park Licence with annual fee of ₹10 lakh to developers of IT parks

title: Folk singer Neha Singh Rathore booked for 'provocative' social media posts
content: Based on the complaint, police registered a case against the folk singer on multiple charges under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS)

title: Supreme Court dismisses convicts’ appeals in Tamil Nadu’s Kannagi-Murugesan ‘honour’ killings case
content: The High Court had commuted the death penalty of one of the convicts to life imprisonment and acquitted two others of all charges. The conviction and life sentence of nine convicts were upheld

title: Cancel appointments made during Senthilbalaji’s tenure as Transport Minister in 2014, Madras High Court urged
content: A Division Bench of Justices R. Subramanian and G. Arul Murugan reserved their judgment on a batch of writ appeals on Monday (April 28, 2025)

title: Centre blocks 16 Pakistani YouTube channels for broadcasting ‘provocative’ content, writes to BBC over reporting on Pahalgam attack
content: Indian government also conveyed its strong sentiments to Jackie Martin, India Head of BBC regarding their reporting on the terror attack, says a government official

title: Rahul Gandhi to visit Rae Bareli, Amethi on April 29-30
content: The leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha will inaugurate a heart unit at Sanjay Gandhi Hospital, Amethi and inspect the ordnance factory located in Munshiganj. File

title: Hybrid ganja case: Actors Shine Tom Chacko, Sreenath Bhasi appear before Excise team for questioning
content: A woman model also appears for questioning. The case pertains to the seizure of 3 kg of hybrid ganja from a resort in Alappuzha on April 1

title: ‘You have acted like ISIS’: Asaduddin Owaisi hits out at Pakistan over Pahalgam terror attack
content: Pakistan always talks about being a nuclear power; they need to remember that if they enter a country and kill innocent people, that country will not sit quietly, Owaisi said

title: Pakistan violates ceasefire in Poonch, Kupwara sectors for fourth consecutive day: Army
content: The Army officials said that Pakistan posts “initiated unprovoked” small arms fire across the LoC in areas opposite Kupwara and Poonch districts

title: Pahalgam attack: Indian diaspora groups counter Pakistani protest in London
content: Indian community in London counter Pakistani protest, chanting patriotic slogans and waving flags, amid tensions over Pahalgam terror attack

title: Pahalgam terror attack LIVE: Congress distances itself from controversial remarks of its leaders on Pahalgam terror attack
content: The Opposition party’s assertion comes in the wake of remarks by leaders like Vijay Wadettiwar, Mani Shankar Aiyar, Shashi Tharoor, Tariq Hameed Karra and Saifuddin Soz that have triggered a row, with the BJP alleging that some from the Opposition party were speaking “Pakistan’s language”

title: Actor Jethwani case: CID police could not question IPS officer Anjaneyulu due to health problem
content: The Court gave three days custody of the accused to the CID police, but investigation officers did not question him as per the advise of the doctors

title: Cheetah gives birth to five cubs at Kuno National Park
content: With the new addition, the number of cheetahs and cubs will increase to 29 at the Kuno park, located in Madhya Pradesh’s Sheopur district

title: Time to teach Pakistan a lesson, says Trinamool’s Abhishek Banerjee
content: Diamond Harbour MP Abhishek Banerjee also added that it is time to reclaim Pakistan Occupied KASHMIR (PoK)

title: Murshidabad riots not spontaneous, says fact finding team; demands judicial inquiry
content: The fact-finding report by five civil rights organisations claimed  that  BJP and RSS are using it for their political gains and sowing seeds of Islamophobia . The report claims that “fake BSF raids targeted only Muslim villages” and “police atrocities created an atmosphere of fear in Muslim villages”

title: JNUSU results: Left Unity wins three posts, ABVP enters JNUSU after ten years with one
content: Vaibhav Meena from ABVP won the Joint Secretary post, making him the first in recent history to have won a central panel post. Meanwhile, ABVP said that it had won 24 councillor posts out of 42.

title: Govt. brings cybercrime centre I4C under PMLA
content: In a notification dated April 25, the Revenue Department under the Finance Ministry included I4C under Section 66 of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

title: Dalai Lama may decide on a spiritual successor during 90th birthday events in July: Central Tibetan Administration leader Penpa Tsering
content: Central Tibetan Administration leader recalls Dalai Lama’s 2011 statement that he will consult religious heads of various Buddhist traditions before taking a call; the Sikyong says he hopes for Indian government representation at the celebration to mark the beginning of the ‘Year of Compassion’

title: T.N. government to consider providing identity cards to inter-State migrant labourers: Minister
